page.title: 07A LOCAL HOUSEWIFE, THORALBY
page.content: We interviewed a local housewife, Jane, who has lived here for 14 years. She has a young family, a girl of 8 and 2 boys 7 & 5, who all go to the village school at West Burton. Her husband cycles to work three times a week so that she can have the car. He works as a Solicitor in the market town 10 miles away. Jane said she does not go out often bacause of lack of transport, but she has two hobbies, Yoga & Acting, which she goes to weekly. They are held in different village halls. She feels that to live happily in this area, it is essential to join in village life. She and her family enjoy gardening and improving their home, built in 1641. The house is one of the earliest stone-built houses in Bishopdale. Mason's marks show that several houses were built by the same builder in the 1630's/1640's.
